title: Harrow School
summary: Harrow School (/ˈhæroʊ/)[1] is a public school (English independent boarding school for boys) in Harrow on the Hill, Greater London, England.[2] The school was founded in 1572 by John Lyon, a local landowner and farmer, under a Royal Charter of Queen Elizabeth I. Harrow's history and influence have made it one of the most prestigious schools in the world.[3][4][5][6][7]
